sub_title: Director Erasmus MC, Dijkzigt| Master Black Belt| RvC Eurofins Clinical Diagnostics| Best-selling author
summary:
Business Administration Director, ER, ICU, CCU, Surgery, Anesthesiology, OR, Physiology, Orthopedics, Oncology, Radio-therapeutics

I will serve in a decisive leadership role to transform an academic healthcare setting into a high-performing center of administrative excellence and play a pivotal role in supporting the overall transformation of VU medical center’s associated initiatives and projects. Responsibilities include overseeing and improving financial strategies and supporting procedures/processes to facilitate strategic, data-driven decision making; conducting financial analyses that enable the development of strategic, multi-year financial models; leveraging financial information and key metrics; identifying talent needs, job design, talent acquisition and movement, and skills and knowledge gaps; driving the process of building a robust pipeline of talent through workforce planning, recruitment, performance management, succession planning, career development, and diversity and inclusion; Our Division supports, stimulates and facilitates scientists and supporting staff in knowledge valorisation. We organize and implement learning and development programs; promote and develope leadership skills and behavior at the individual contributor and management levels; implementing operating practices and procedures related while continually driving operational change and efficiencies; overseeing the administration of facilities and space management; and ensuring proactive and responsive administrative support for department staff.

Specialties: Leadership & Change Management, LEAN thinking and working, Building new ICU's, Quality and Safety projects in Health Care Organizations, Biblical Economics, Touring car bus driver

treasury_media.title: BoekTerObservatieKjeldAij.pdf
treasury_media.description: In de persoonlijke verhalenbundel 'Ter observatie' vertelt Kjeld Aij hoe hij zelf met vallen en opstaan omgaat met de complexiteit binnen de zorg. Want wie met een helikopterview naar de Nederlandse ziekenhuizen kijkt, ziet een sector die kraakt en piept in zijn voegen. Arbeidskrapte, ketenzorg, vergrijzing, regeldruk en een pandemie – door de vele schijnbaar onoplosbare vraagstukken zit iedereen in een spagaat.

treasury_media.title: LÂ˛ Zorg. Lean leiderschap in de praktijk
treasury_media.description: Lean heeft zijn intrede in menige zorginstelling gedaan. Lean is een managementfilosofie om iedere dag en met iedereen in de organisatie doelgericht te verbeteren om tot reductie van verspilling in processen te komen. Dit boek gaat over lean in de zorg.

treasury_media.title: L2Zorg: Lean Leiderschap in de praktijk
treasury_media.description: Wilt u Lean gaan invoeren in uw zorginstelling? Dan is het lezen van dit boek een aanrader: L2Zorg - Lean Leiderschap in de praktijk. De auteurs, Kjeld Aij en Bas Lohman, zijn ervaren Lean managers in het VUmc. In hun business roman beschrijven zij de Lean reis van het fictieve UMC Zorgelo.

treasury_media.title: Lean denken in de zorg_blog_Rouppe_van_der_Voort
treasury_media.description: Voor u ligt een belangrijk boek. De afgelopen jaren heeft de toepassing van de lean principes en methodes in de zorg een grote vlucht genomen om zorgprocessen te verbeteren. De ervaringen zijn gunstig, getuige de praktijkverhalen uit de eerste twee boeken over lean in de zorg, en het is duidelijk geworden dat lean nog veel meer potentie biedt.

company.name: Lean Healthcare Research Consortium | Lean Measurement Workgroup

profile_positions.company: Lean Healthcare Research Consortium | Lean Measurement Workgroup
profile_positions.description:
The Lean Measurement Workgroup will determine what dimensions, factors and constructs of lean should be included in a survey of "leanness" of a healthcare practice and will develop measures of these dimensions.
The workgroup will also develop measures of the value proposition of the healthcare organizations as well as other outcome measures such asreturn-on-investment, reduction in the number of adverse events, increased patient satisfaction, etc. This in effect will provide a measure of the commitment of the top leadership of the organization to lean.
These measures will be combined into a survey instrument that could be administered as a multi-level instrument. The instrument would provide the ability to measure an organization's longitudinal achievements as well as assess differences between departments and allow the organization to plan interventions to change their performance.
profile_positions.title: Research member

profile_positions.description:
TheCollege part-time bible school facilitates a compassionate learning environment where people experience God through Jesus Christ for personal and communal development and transformation.

Since the inception of TheCollege in 2001 our college has been a light house for excellence, drawing students from all over The Netherlands and Belgium into a most amazing atmosphere where students of the Word of Christ have incredible fellowship during our weekends in Renaix (Ronse). 

The fact that an excess of 300+ students have graduated through our highly esteemed college speaks volumes.

See also: www.thecollege.nl

Through Jesus we discover our unlimited potential and we become complete and healthy. It is our passion to inspire each other so that dreams become reality. Walking with God. Enjoying life.

profile_positions.title: Business Administration Director

profile_positions.description:
Since April 2009, VU University Medical Center has a new Operation Complex on the sixth floor. Build to the latest guidelines. In addition, there are two Operation Rooms build, fully equipped for endoscopic operations and there is one Room specially fit for stem cell operations. The new complex has an entire 8th floor, especially for technology. On the seventh floor all related facilities are located. 

See also: http://www.medicalfacts.nl/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/ok-vumc.jpg
profile_positions.title: Head of Operating Theaters | Phd candidate

profile_positions.description:
From February 2005 till January 2010 I worked as a manager at the Intensive Care Units for Adults at VU University Medical Center. This Level 3 Intensive Care had about 170 Full Time Equivalents spread over 2 ICU locations (28 beds) and 1 Medium Care location (9 beds). The department has a dual management structure.  The department worked with a consolidated operating budget of approximately € 14 million. 

As manager I was responsible for the (financial) policy, business, management, research and training and assumed front line responsibility and accountability for managing the delivery of patient care. I was responsible for the total management of the ICU units of 37 beds, which includes setting goals and objectives in accordance with the clients’ strategic initiatives, and for planning, organizing, directing, and monitoring unit activities on a 24 hour basis. Fiscally responsible for the unit, facilitating efficient and cost effective daily operations. I implemented the units strategic plan relevant to the clients initiatives, while continuing to develop professional and support staff in establishing an environment where staff and patients were able to reach their full potential.
 
The last 3 years I have provided guidance to include various projects in the areas of quality and patient safety, such as setting up a skills lab, implementation of a satellite pharmacy and preparation for NIAZ accreditation. Furthermore, I was closely involved in the implementation of two 'Sneller Beter projects' Decubitus and Reporting Incidents. 

Last year, I was responsible for the introduction of a Rapid Response Team, the establishment of an outpatient Intensive Care and member of the steering committee Complication Registration as part of the Safety Management System. 
I was also responsible for the design and preparation of the in 2011 new to build ICU with over 44 ICU beds.
profile_positions.title: Manager ICU
